item.title: Overhanging tree very close to house, 17th August
item.description:
We have a tree outside No 2 Robert Burns Avenue which is getting very close to the house with overhanging branches. I estimate it to be within 6-8 feet of the building. There are numerous trees in the road but none of them are anywhere near the adjoining houses. The branches are blocking natural light and this week we had a squirrel jump from the tree onto the roof of the house, Without being addressed the situation is obviously only going to get worse so could we have some of these branches trimmed back please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Robert Burns Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous paving, 17th August
item.description:
Montpellier Walk This is not the first unfortunately but this afternoon at about 3.30pm a Gentleman of 70 plus years, tripped over an uneven slab of pavement (approximately 2 inches in depth) and fell approximately 2 metres untill landing on his head above his eye (in photo). The area is generally uneven all over , with wobbly and cracked slabs from the path from COOP to Morgans Associates. As it's the entrance to Cheltenham and all it's festivals. It would be lovely to see some maintenance in the area? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incomplete Repair, 16th August
item.description:
This pothole / sinkhole was reported some time ago, as the cones placed around it were reducing the road width so much that vehicles were in danger of meeting head on. This week, workmen dug a load of soil etc out of the hole, coned it off and haven’t been seen since. So the hazard is now worse than it was due ti a bigger hole with more cones around it. Why start the work and then just vanish without a trace? Surely it’s not that complicated to fill a hole in?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th August
item.description:
This tree is becoming very dangerous. It's the largest tree in the street, and the branches overhang our drive way as well as the house on the opposite side of the road. The tree is interfering with the electricity cables overhead, and the roots are now pushing up our pathway towards the house. The branches that have been falling are large, and it's lucky that they haven't hurt someone or caused damage to any cars yet.
Report on FixMyStreet
